review: I have eaten here before and have had decent service but after today, I'm done. Walked and sat down in the bar. Waited, watched the servers walk by and ignore us. Waited some more. Watched the bartender lean against the bar, away from the patrons and continue watching the football game. After 15 minutes, we walked out. My husband let the manager know it was ridiculous but as I use Yelp all the time, thought this might actually be more useful. Won't be eating there again.

Just your average Red Robin, no better or worse than I have had elsewhere.  I don't like the change to the Bonzai burger, but it is different at all locations.  their quality in general seems to have gone down in the last few years.

Absolutely worst service is becoming the norm at this restaurant. We arrived and no service until AFTER four other groups seated after us were served. Finally after more than 15 minutes and we asked for a manager, a server came to our table. Then the manager came and offered us a free desert. I have never eaten a desert at Red Robin and don't plan to today. I don't want anything free, I just want service!!!

The friendly bar wait staff are an attribute at this Red Robin location.  That is what keeps us coming back to this close to home option. Efficient service and the bar area seating is better spaced then the main dining area.   While the booths in the main area are comfortable, unfortunately the middle sections, table areas, are incredibly cramped.   The seating is too close,  causing elbows to hit your head and need to scoot in order to allow others by.   Food and beverage are typical Red Robin; all locations are the same.   Plenty of reliable selections. That said when properly cooked the fries are scrumptious, however more times than not they've been overcooked recently.  The wait time for food the last two times has been exceptionally long.   The buns were burnt the last time we were there.  How could that not be noticed?  We had waited so long for our food perhaps the kitchen was taking extra time to burn it? The alcoholic beverages are on the weak side, making it an expensive option consideration of what you receive.   Yet typical for chain type restaurant.  That started they're flavorful, great tasting.   Nonalcoholic freckled lemonade, with free refills, are a refreshing good choice.   The shakes are thick and delicious. The menu offers many burger, chicken options, salads,  and other American food options.  The onion rings are a favorite appetizer, two order sized options. Be sure to sign up for the red robin royalty card, giving you free meal options and other deals.

We came in today craving sandwiches!  There was a bit of a wait. . No big deal.  Got seated. . Didn't see a waitress for nearly 15 minutes and it was only so she could say she would be back in a minute.  Finally got our drinks. . Which was water.  We ordered the hummus plate which was a huge mistake.  They brought us a plate that was a fourth of a head of lettuce with maybe 3 table spoons of hummus. .soggy red bell pepper.. celery ends were not cut. . So we could see all the dirt and nastiness.  We have been here over an hour and still waiting for food. .... Asked about food at the hour and 15 mark.  We were told they were currently plating it.  Food finally came to the table. . Cold.  My boyfriend had a chicken bruschetta sandwich and sweet potato fries.. his sandwich was about room temp and fries were cold. . He ate the fries quickly hoping to get more that were hopefully hot. She didn't come check on us again until we were both nearly done with our entire meal.  Asked for more fries. . Were brought regular fries instead of sweet potato.  Thanks buddy. At least they were hot this time.  I had a side salad and California chicken sandwich.  My salad was ice cold and crispy.. literally the only good thing about the visit.  Sandwich was room temp with a soggy bottom bun and hard top bun.   We were finally brought a check which took  10 minutes to pick up and did not bring back an itemized receipt with a feed back number.  I expect way more from a place that charges nearly 11 dollars for a burger.

I have to say, that Red Robin and gone down in service and gone up in price. We went in for my son's birthday and by the time we got completely done and was ready for the check. They remember to sing to him. All the waitress said was that she was sorry she forgot.  Our food was gross and the place was dirty. I would have given it a 1/2 a star but the system would not let me. Beside why should we have to tip when everything is become computerised or we have to push a button for us to talk to our server.

Nope. Not worth it anymore. Used to go to Red Robin with the family all the time. Last time we went our fries were terrible, the strawberry lemonade tasted fake and syrupy, and none of us liked out meals. Will not be going back to Red Robin again. They went downhill.

I used to be a manager for RR, and worked with them for 19 years. You might think I'm positive biased, but you'd be wrong. I notice the mistakes easily, since everything else is how it should be. I can also say that I wasn't recognized since this wasn't one of my locations or familiar staff. That said: Great visit!! I came in at 3pm, so a slower time, but also when a small mistake is more obvious. A friendly host greeted me at the door and when I opted to sit in the bar, she wished me a great lunch. Anthony, the cocktailer, greeted me within a couple minutes with a menu and silverware on a little tray. Rather than detailing every little thing, I think a flurry of adjectives would do. They were prompt, courteous, efficient, and attentive to any needs. The food was correct, meaning it was timely, cold was cold, and hot was hot. Also, my burgers build was correct and it had PPPP (picture perfect plate presentation). It was cooked correctly and was truly delicious. Even the other superlatives were on point. The restaurant was clean, the music was at an appropriate level, and there was a general positive vibe.  As a past manager, I would say that this is a really good example of the Red Robin experience.  Now, something I've always wanted to say.  To all the folks who write reviews behind a keyboard, and don't have the ability to talk to a manager. To all those who write "worst ______ ever" (really?). To those who never asked for more fries, then are surprised they didn't get a refill (duh, RR will waste food and keep you table full??). To those that don't realize this place is kid friendly. To those that don't realize that evenings are busy, Friday and Saturday is busy, after the local soccer game is busy, etc. Get over it! Have some awareness of where you are, and what's expected of yourself. The average employee age is 20-22, so set your expectations accordingly. Sometimes people have an off day.You are not at Ruth's Chris steakhouse. It's only burgers and fries folks, don't make it more than it is. Have fun!

I came in with my kids and was seated unfortunately next to someone clearly high on something and being very vulgar. I let the staff know, they immediately reseated us and we're very apologetic. I didn't expect anything from them but the GM came to our table and apologized up and down after kicking them out and gave my kids milkshakes. So sweet! Great service all around!

By far the worst location for Red Robin my family has ever been to. Every time we have come in there have been MAJOR problems that require a manager to get involved. The wait staff are generally inattentive or downright rude, and food tends to come out of the kitchen stone cold.  Another issue is that we have 2 members of the family with severe gluten allergies. The menu lends itself well to eating gluten free with gluten free buns, or no bun, and (supposedly) a separate frier for french fries. But when you express the needs based on an ALLERGY and you get baskets of fries with battered onion rings and other breaded bits of food in the bottom, it's obvious the staff couldn't care less about cross contamination or safety of guests.  In addition getting fry refills can take as long as 20-30 minutes and most of the time requests are completely ignored by wait staff. Service and food delivery is painfully slow, as our last visit it took 20 minutes to get drinks, another 20 for the server to come back after that ( drinks delivered by what appeared to be a bus boy), another 20 minutes for appetizers, and then ANOTHER 30 minutes for meals, which were delivered cold and soggy, with like MAYBE 10 sweet potato fries on each plate, all burnt to a crisp. Asking for more fries took another 25 minutes, at which time a 1/4 basket showed up, also cold, and with bits of onion rings all over the place. By this time we are just fed up and decided to leave and haven't been back since after talking to a manager who could not have been less interested in the issues.

I have NEVER been treated with such poor customer service as I did tonight. My daughters 5th birthday was supposed to be filled with laughter and fun while enjoying a nice celebration dinner. Instead we were left waiting 35 minutes for milkshakes, 50 minutes for our food and service well enough from A hospital cafeteria- bland, rude and ingenious. When I asked why everything was taking so long the response was " im not a cook and I don't make the drinks so I don't know".  In my own experience, personal and professional, I know one thing- if you can't rectify a customer service issue, you shouldn't be in customer service.  I too used to work at Red Robin many years ago, and was disappointed in the direction of their values. Poor job. If I could've chose no star in my review- I would have.

I hate this restaurant!  My family used to love coming here, so we thought we would give them another chance.  Wait time 1/2 hour, restaurant was 1/2 full, when finally got food after another 20 minute wait it was luke warm. Fries were nasty, cold . DO NOT EAT HERE!

The food here is good, the service friendly, and the atmosphere is family oriented. My only complaint is that the portion sizes have gotten smaller and prices have gone up. Also, the only macaroni and cheese on the adults menu is subpar but the kid's mac is served in the smallest bowl in the world. I miss the bottomless kids kraft mac n cheese.

Very disappointed in the quality of our food we just received as a to go order. My boss, coworker, and I each ordered a salad (2 cob, 1 chicken caesar with grilled chicken), and each a half order of onion rings. When my coworker got back with our food, my cob salad was significantly smaller than my bosses, which was smaller than their half size salads were. They were also missing egg, which was replaced with cucumber without our knowledge.  My coworker received two halves of wilted romaine with greasy bacon bunched up and NO chicken (this is apparently the insane romain).  When we called to complain, we were told about the national egg shortage? which is why there was no eggs... Would have been nice to hear when I placed our orders. There was no explanation on why there was no grilled chicken in the romain salad like I had asked for.  We also learned that the quality of food is better than previously, which is why my salad is tiny. Does this look like quality?

You know exactly what you are getting at the McDonalds of the sit-down dining world. The food is always pretty good, the service is always spotty (great 20% of the time, and horrible 80% of the time), and they will almost always mess up the order of somebody at your table. I have kids, and this is their favorite place, so we used to go about every other week. When the kids started to notice that the service was bad, that was when we stopped going. "Dad, are they supposed to mess up the order every time?"  Expect to wait, expect to send something back, and you'll be fine. If you are in a hurry, or have low tolerance, just go to Blazing Onion, The Ram, or Bob's to get your grub. Even though they are a little further, you'll come out ahead on time.

Worst red robin I've ever dined at. Our server was rude and did not check on us once. Got mad when someone in our party asked if they could have no ranch in their chicken wrap. Will not return to this location.

What a terrible experience today at Smokey Point Red Robin.  After a long wait for a table, we watched the party that arrived after us get seated before us.  The hostess offered a weak explanation that their iPad sometimes shuffles tables - how does that work? The time between when we sat down and ordered drinks was about standard.  Once we ordered we waited about 35+ minutes for our food to come out.  The kids spaghetti plate, which we ordered the big size of, came out and was pathetically small. We complained and they brought a 2nd small portion (see pictures).  Seriously, this is pasta we're talking about here, the old kid's portion seemed larger. About half way through eating we ordered a 2nd basket of fries, and asked for them crispy.  They came out promptly and were so crispy they were burned.   The final insult was when the check came.  There was a 1.99 entertainment fee?! I assume it came from the stupid entertainment tablet on the table when the kids were looking at it.  We complained about the fee, at least warn us when we sit down that there's pay to play games.  The waiter to make things right, offered up $5 from "his own wallet".  We refused the money, what we wanted was for him to remove the charge.  So, he took his money back.  When we got the final check with the receipt to sign, it turned out that there was a 1.99 cash payment to offset the charge.  I get he was trying to make it right, but after we refused his money this was the wrong way to make it right. All in all, a very disappointing experience at Red Robin, we won't be back to this one.

Just walked out of this place in disgust. There were five of us and the restaurant was not busy.  We ordered food and asked three times for fries to come out early. The waiter came back once to fill our water glasses then avoided us for 45 minutes.  No sign of food for us anytime soon and no explanation so we left.  No one cared.  Never had service this bad at any Red Robin, including this one before.
Met my wife and her sister their earlier today and we all came down with food poisoning shortly after. Will never eat there again

This is the 2nd time I've been to a Red Robin, the first time was almost 10 years ago and at another location. Sad to say, not much has changed let alone been improved. The husband and I decided to hit up RR because we were in the mood for burgers and glancing over the menu online, the Poutine caught our attention. The descriptions of the burgers also helped seal the deal. We were greeted and seated by a very friendly young lady, then our server, another friendly young lady, showed up within minutes. We ordered our drinks and an appetizer, which were received in a timely manner. The Poutine was damn tasty. We then ordered our burgers, both from the tavern menu. Hubs ordered the Turbo Q and I the Ghost Pepper and substituted onion rings. My burger was alright, nothing stellar. The fresh jalapeños were fresh and crisp and the fried ones weren't soggy, but the burger lacked the heat I was anticipating. The onion rings were too greasy and the breading just flaked off. It made me a little sad. Everything tasted alright all in all. Hubs wasn't impressed with his burger. It all came down to the bun. He liked it well enough, but had he known it was going to be a plain Jane sesame seed bun, he'd have requested a lettuce wrap instead. A different bun would have helped my burger as well. The restaurant was very clean and the staff was very friendly. Only real complaint is the temperature of the restaurant steadily increased to an uncomfortable level before finally cooling off as we were leaving. I'm giving RR 3 stars because it wasn't that great and the selection of beer is severely lacking. Hubs and I might return for appetizers and drinks, but not bothering with the main menu.

I always end up at a Red Robin when I'm absolutely starving... and I always leave absolutely stuffed. This location had incredible service, especially considering that we ate during the lunchtime rush. Service: The three of us were seated immediately and given menus. Our server came by to get our menus and he was both friendly and professional. We placed our orders for a stack of towering onion rings and burgers, and received them shortly after. They were quick with our food and would come back often to see if we wanted refills on our sides. Food: The onion rings are delicious. Always a fan-favourite. We ended up getting the bonsai burger, the bleu burger, and the sriracha double tavern with sides of fries and a side salad. We were very happy with our burgers and I appreciated that you could swap out the bottomless fries for a bottomless side salad. Ambiance/Cleanliness: No problems whatsoever. It's a clean establishment with the diner feel.

Well, it's been a year since my last 2 star review. And yes, it's a 1 star now. The food is still good, the service is still horrible. We came in on a Tuesday night. Our server took forever to take our order and just could not follow up fast enough for our liking.  My wife had an empty water glass for a solid 10 minutes. I had to get up and grab my own mustard. I understand that good help is hard to come by these days.  At least the manager could have come around and checked in on us since the place was not busy. With all the other places around Arlington, we are tired of the bad service and will be dining elsewhere. There's a reason why Red Robbin has 2.5 stars.

Red Robin used to be one of my favorite places to go but the food hasn't been that great lately. I had a tavern double. The service was pretty good. They say the fries are bottomless how could they be when you are lucky if they bring them even after requesting?

I ordered a med rare burger.  When it came, it was well done.  When the server was notified she made up excuses including she was new and she can only put pink or not pink in the computer.  And the kitchen was busy.  It was pointed out the burgers were clearly NOT pink.  She said she would have her manager come talk with us.  She proceeded to then ignore us.  We watched as her manager ran around and also ignored us.  Eventually she came back and said her manager was really busy and would come over soon.   My friend proceeded to suggest she order another "not pink burger." Duh.....  Also, we both ordered bloody marys which did not taste like they had alcohol in it.  When this was pointed out, she again made up an excuse stating " i watched the bartender put in the shots".  Clearly this server and manager know nothing about customer service.

We arrived for Father's Day. They were under staffed. Lots of empty tables but no waiter to take orders. Finally we were swatted after  45 minutes because more wait staff came in. It is father day and they should have staffed accordingly.  We ordered our food. About 10 min later the fries came..and came..still No drinks. Then the food came and the buns Were stale. Not too happy with our visit. Appeared not to be very clean, silver ware on the floor under our table, the ketchup bottles are sticky, the menus are sticky and  dirty.  Very disappointed with our visit.

This is the first time I've been to this Red Robin at Twin Lakes. I should have read the reviews first. I ordered a black and blue burger...rare, because I like it pink. The burger brought to me was burnt on the edges and more than well done...no mooing at all. I called the waitress over and she said she would talk to her manager....45 minutes later....still no manager. The waitress came back...I told her she needed to order me a new burger that was cooked right and that I had been waiting long enough. Also, the Bloody Mary I ordered tasted like it didn't have any alcohol in it. I mentioned it to my waitress, who assured me the second one would have more alcohol...it, unfortunately, was less strong than the first, which I did not think was possible. I won't be coming back.
Extremely  rude bartender. Poor service. Long wait times. Had my change thrown at me when I informed her that the tab was incorrect.  Rather go to applebees....

The food (burger) was surprisingly good. Gourmet? Yes. Very special tasting burger. However they lost a customer because of how SLOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOW the service was... I mean our server was nice and all but the food took 40 mins to arrive and the place wasn't even half full. By looking at other comments they definitely work on customer skill and hiring more employees.... it's too bad because the food is really good!

Ive come to this Red Robin since it first opened in Marysville. Gradually over the years the food has gone downhill. The last couple of times I've gone in the service has been very bad. You have to get the attention of wait staff EVERYTIME you need a refill or anything and they make it seem like a very hard task.  Ive always been a huge fan of their crispy chicken burger and the chicken Caesar wrap. I ordered the crispy chicken burger to go yesterday with mozzarella sticks. Walk in and it's packed the front host just waved me over to the bar when I said I had a to go order. The mozzarella sticks were good. Crispy chicken burger was the worst burger Ive had. All I could taste was the oil it was fried in- disgusting. Last few times I had the chicken Caesar wrap there is barely any chicken in it and the wrap always tastes like it's been left out and stale. What a shame.
Food was good. We weren't greeter for like 20 mins that was disappointing. The waitress didn't seem happy at all, better service needed with happier people!!

TBH, I have never had a bad experience at Red Robin. It is consistent, the food is good and the drinks are made well. Our server, Christine, is a great ambassador to this business. It's crowded and busy and the vibe of this place is good. I like this place, it's delivers what it should, fun, food, and a place to hang with people you care ab

I don't know what it is about this particular location, but we will not be back. Every single time, there's an issue.  On multiple occasions, we've been sat and forgotten. Each time, a server from halfway across the restaurant (the same guy twice, ironically) has come over and said that we looked like we'd been forgotten, we weren't in his section but he'd take care of us.  Service from the kitchen is always slow.  Last night, in what was our final visit to this location, it took forever to be acknowledged after being sat. When our food finally arrived, my Ensenada Chicken Platter arrived cold (not cool, cold) and hard. Think "hockey puck chicken". Every other location seems to be able to get this correct; this location can't seem to get very much correct.  I worked for many years in the restaurant industry, and I feel I'm extra lenient when it comes to slow service or order mistakes. The issues in this location aren't a result of being constantly slammed; they're a result of mismanagement. Take your business elsewhere. We will.

I was craving red robin fries and my wife and kids wanted to go. Had a bad experience before but gave it another shot because I've been a customer at other red robin locations for years.  We arrived at 630 on Saturday evening. The wait was 25 minutes, no problem. Got seated, got drinks, placed and order for two kids meals and two burgers with sodas. Then waited.  And waited. And waited some more. Got soda refills, then waited some more. Then continued to wait.  Our server was not to be found.  Saw food piling up under heat lamps in the kitchen. Finally, at 800, my kids couldn't take any more. After waiting at the table for an hour, we gave up and went across the street to 5 guys burgers. Got served within two minutes. Tasted great!  Never going back to this red robin location. Too many bad experiences there in the past.  I offered to pay the manager for our drinks. He said that since we had no alcohol, he would pay for the drinks.

Went there on a weekday evening. My wife and I wanted to the dinner and a movie thing lime we used to when we were dating.  Sounded great to us! But it wasn't to be so great. The service was mediocre and the food took a long time. It wasn't even hot when we got it. It tasted O K but certainly not good or great. The sad part is they weren't even busy. RR has gone downhill.  WAY downhill. I used to really love going to RR but  now I would much rather go to the junkyard grill or blazing onion.

The service over the past year has been very hit and miss (mostly miss), but we are lifetime Red Robin fans, so we continue to go back. Went last Thursday and Anthony was our server in the bar area.  Really, really stood out for his attention to detail, service, and attitude.  This guy made the whole restaurant stand out--thanks for all you do to embrace your job and for providing excellent customer service!

Probably one of the worst locations I've been too. My fiance and I sat in the bar. It took ten minutes before anyone brought us menus or water. I asked for onion rings and those took 20 minutes to get out to us. The onion ring burnt my mouth soooo bad that I can't eat on my left side. It's been since Saturday. (I'll attach photo)  25 minutes into eating our onions rings our sever asked if there was anything else she could bring us...ummmm our meal that we ordered.?????  Another 30 minutes later....we got our food.  Our server wasn't very attentive. The whole experience wasn't fun and we were there longer than we wanted too.  Alot of the employees kept ignoring several paying customers because they were too busy chatting it up with 2 employees who were off the clock sitting in the bar.  Won't ever come back to this location.  Horrible service.

Meh. It's Red Robin. It's pretty decent but it seems that no matter which location I go to, they always forget some of the ingredients on the burgers. If it says something comes on your sandwich on the menu it doesn't necessarily mean it makes it there. They are always nice about getting what was missing and or taking a couple of bucks off the bill. That's nice, but I wish they would just get it right the first time to begin with.  My other gripe is the price. Damn! When did the food get smaller and the price go up?! Ok so I will still go there, but more begrudgingly. Who can complain about bottomless fries though? Those always win you over and drag you back in for more. They do make really killer shakes too. I don't seek out RR but it's not a terrible option either. They just need to get their act together in the worst way

Terrible experience tonight at Red Robin.  Took 1 hour to get our food.  People who came in after us got food before we did.  No apology at all for it being so long.  We will not be coming back for a long while.
Food was good, Service not so much. Took 10 minutes for soda and lemonade refill. Had 4 different people bring us stuff, waitress kept forgetting stuff that we asked for.

Red Robin was really crowded both times I visited this location. There were lines that required waiting for a seat, but for what reason I do not know. I'm not desperate enough to wait that long for ordinary, generic food. But I did get that food one time when I was with a group that insisted on coming here for lunch. There's nothing special here, so I'd rather go somewhere else next time. I don't even remember what I ordered because it was so bland. Some burger that was apparently under 600 calories, although I doubt that due to the inclusion of two beef patties, jalapeno peppers, and fries. Nothing special, and kind of expensive, so not worthy of a recommendation. One thing they had that was cool was a chalkboard tile and some chalk for drawing on, but that's seriously grasping for straws if I give extra points to a restaurant for that.

When did someone decided we needed a sing songy phoney waitress?  She was efficient enough but we just wanted her to leave cause she was so annoying. Husband said hamburger meal was "so-so" and my salad was not fresh at all, clearly dumped from a bag  Prices too high for any of this.  Not good food and ok service.  Nothing new but we hadn't been to RR for a while and thought we would try again.  Way too many other places around there that are much better  Bye Bye RR

Came here for luch today.  Wasn't overly busy but still enough people dining.  Pretty much the usual typical Red Robin food.  Never have been disappointed but also never overwhelmed by the food.  Have to admit, the server was really awesome.  My son ordered the wrong drink and she happily replaced it. Would I come back again???  Sure, why not.

What happened to Red Robin? Our burgers were so much smaller than they use to be. We went there to celebrate our daughters birthday, told the server when we first were seated. We received no recognition, no singing nothing, also they didn't clear any dishes from our table. We asked for more fries and they never came. The server then didn't take the birthday burger off our bill either. I had to stand up and wait at the podium with my money but even then ,the server ignored me. So I then found the manager. We have been going to the RR for for about 7 years now BUT NO MORE. There are alot of better places to eat that treats a customer much better.
This has always been a favorite location for my littles and I, we enjoy the food but are particularly fond of the kindness and attentiveness to the customers! Great place to take the family!
Here I sit again in this restaurant and I don't know why!! The service here is beyond atrocious!! No one comes to our table forever!! 4 people seated after us were served before us!

I visited the Smokey Point Red Robin with my party of nine to celebrate my son's 8th birthday.  As a part of the Red Robin Royalty Club, my son had a free birthday meal, and he really wanted to go to Red Robin on his special day.   We have noticed a significant decline in the quality of Red Robin's food over the last couple of years.  It is apparent that the company is trying to cut costs by making serving sizes smaller.  I observed that the kids' menus no longer come with crayons and pages to color, but rather in standard laminated form.   The options for vegetarians are very limited, and the options for vegans are even more limited.  I follow a vegan diet and ordered the hummus plate tonight.  Last time, I ordered the hummus plate, and had so much hummus that I brought some home.  This time, the quantity of hummus had greatly decreased and was not enough to put a little on every bite of food on the hummus plate.  The only other menu items I can eat are the black beans, steamed broccoli, Boca burger, and fries.  Red Robin does have a "designated fryer" for cooking food for people with food allergies, and vegans.   Tonight, all of our our food arrived lukewarm.    Our server changed halfway through our meal, and the second server had not been informed of our dietary restrictions.  The first server was friendly but confused by our dietary and split check requests.  The second server was not friendly, and after she took over, we saw the first server bussing tables.  It was quite strange.  The best service we got came from someone I took to be a manager, who came our table to clarify our special dietary requests.  Our meals were served with no utensils, and no beverage refills were offered.  As we left, our server did not even look at us, and the hostess did not acknowledge us either.   Red Robin checks used to be delivered to customers with comment cards, but there was no way for us to comment on our dining experience this evening.  The absence of comment cards gives the impression that they don't really care if customers are unhappy.   I do not expect that we will return to Red Robin...unless our kids beg us to go for their next birthdays.
The staff is excellent  but the food is very overpriced. I mean, $15 for a burger? Anyway, go for the people, they make it fun at least.

One of our favorite local restaurants.  The turkey burger is delicious. Avoid peak times like Friday or Saturday nights from about 5-8 and you won't be disappointed.  They only have so many tables you know. Lots of variety on the menu. Try asking your waitperson for EXTRA CRISPY fries or onion rings next time. Make sure they bring tartar, ranch, campfire sauce for your sides. Sign up for their Red Robin Royalty card and get a free burger during the month of your birthday.

Place is filthy!  I have been to other red robin restaurants and have always enjoyed getting their blue ribbon burger.  Never fails to be a good meal.  This one was made so spicy, I did not even finish it.  For the prices they charge, I expect to be able to walk to my table without feeling like I am walking on an ice rink, (food and crayons all over the floor). Be able to eat the food I order.  Burger was crap.  how do you screw up a burger??  Waitress was useless.  They only give you a few french fries (which are good) to start with.  They are supposedly going to bring you more, but that never happened. Bottom line is do yourself a favor, save your money and go over to Wendy's or one of the other burger places around there.  You'll be better off.
Always a good go to if you want solid food and service. The apps are good, lots to chose from on the menu.

Awful service tonight.  They weren't even busy other tables were served and after 45 minutes of waiting no food, no offer of anything.  The floor manager just made excuses.  I've never ever had such horrible service.  Seriously how long does it take to cook a burger? I've never had to wait that long even on a busy night.  I gave the waitress an opportunity to make it right and nothing.  I can't feed a six year old air.  So disappointed that I can expect better service at the drive thru window at McDonald's than at Red Robin - boo!

Staff is amazing here. Erica the manager was so helpful to us today. The facility is super clean, staff is very friendly and the food is fresh and exactly what you hope it to be. Ambiance is great too. Definitely recommend this nice sweet location to anyone looking for a nice meal and a good time.
At Lakewood Crossing Red Robin customer in lobby had a small dog. Hostess was petting it. Totally gross!!!

I used to cook for red Robin. I try not to let that horrible experience tie into my review but unfortunately the last few times I have been into red Robin I haven't had the greatest service. Our waitress messed up my food, everything that I asked to not be on my burger was placed on my burger. I get that the majority of the people working there are around age 21 but that shouldn't give them the right to be playing around on their phones while they're on the clock. I felt like the waitress was more into her phone then all of the tables she was supposed to be waitressing. My tip: when you sit down, ask for a fry fill that way you won't get charged. If you ask for a side of fries they will charge you for it so I ask for a fry fill since you get unlimited fries with your meal. I personally think you shouldn't have to pay for fries in the first place, you don't have to pay for the bread most other restaurants serve you when you first sit down.
My kid loves some burger that they make there. I've never been very impressed. RR is just so noisy and loud, I cannot hear my friends and the food just does not make up for the racket!

Last night was my last attempt at this restaurant. It wasn't busy, but the hostess really hesitated at giving us a booth, then when I insisted, she gestured and said, "Fine, pick one." I was happy to see unlimited broccoli offered in place of fries, and we each ordered a burger with that as our side. 20 minutes later, and no refills on my water or his soda ever offered, we received our burgers. Mine was the wrong burger altogether, but I ate it anyway as we were in a bit of a rush and I couldn't wait. And the broccoli was cold. I mean not even lukewarm.  We had finished the burgers by the time the server returned, and when we told her about the cold broccoli, her response was, "well, I can get you more, because you can have unlimited refills.". Uh, yeah, or, you could just replace my broccoli since I haven't eaten it.  Needless to say, we didn't wait for our replacement veggies and were ever-so-generously given a 10% discount on our overpriced burgers. So for $23, we each had a burger, no sides, and one soda. Lesson learned. I've been there a half-dozen times in the past few years and I've always felt it was overpriced, but the service there is in the toilet.

The only reason I would give this place a 2* is because of the food which was pretty decent. The service on the other hand was horrible. The 45 minutes we had dinner the waitress came by twice. They brought us hot wings without napkins!? I had to get napkins out of my wife's purse to clean up. I've hd similar experiences at this same location and I have them the benefit but this is beyond ridiculous. Please fix this. Red Robin is one of my favorite places.

Used to love this place but the last three time over the last month have been horrible. The orders always come back wrong, always have to ask for silverware and napkin. It's always hard to get refills of fries and drinks.There are no longer comment cards and our table didn't have drink menus of anything. And the food.. ugh what happened!!! The burgers seem to be smaller and the cooks don't appear to know how to them or eggs. This time we asked for certain types of eggs and extra cheese, didn't get either and what is the point when they cover almost every inch in black pepper! The Royal burger came with guacamole all over the bottom of the bun, so I guess they are following many food handles protocols. It then took 25mins to get a replacement burger and in fact it was the only hot burger of the 4 we ordered. And only tonight did they inform us about the rewards system. the waitress usually care more about talk with each other where they pick up food or with the hostesses.  The poor people sitting beside us couldn't even get a waitress to show up so they could pay and they had clearly been done for 30mins I didn't think it could get anywise until I woke up all throughout the night sick to my stomach. Thanks for the food poisoning!  I am hoping to never have to come back. The place has gone so downhill and not worth the money at all. I could have gotten a better burger just about anywhere else.

This was seriously the most under-flavored burger I have had in years.  They were nice enough to put raw mushrooms on at my request but nothing in the burger had any flavor. My taste buds are highly disappointed.
Food was ok. Service times could've used some work. Hubby and I came here earlier around 3 pm on a Thursday. Not exactly prime time but we still had to wait a while for our food.

Normally I'm either neutral or really impressed when it comes to service at a restaurant, but WOW. I had to make a yelp account just to comment on how terrible my experience here was. The waitress (don't remember her name cause she never introduced herself and was gone for like 70% of the time we were there) came to initially greet us kind of late---we usually take time to look over the menu so it actually wasn't too bad, so didn't mind this. Waitress took our drink orders, offered to activate our ziosk, and took our food orders. I specified no tomatoes on my burger, cause hey I'm not a big fan. And I asked for a side of ranch to come with our appetizer. Waitress came with our drinks pretty much disappeared after that. Appetizer comes, and no ranch. Slight oversight probably, and it was actually good without it so whatever, I dealt with it. Food comes, dropped off by another staff member. Looks great! Oh wait, tomato on the burger. Man well that's disappointing, but oh well I pick it off and continue with the meal. Still no sign of waitress.  We are all more than halfway through the meal, still no waitress, mom is wondering if we get refill on fries. I thought well normally they'd check on us by now, see how we're doing, so it's strange that nobody has stopped by. Maybe I'll hit the ziosk "call server" button. It does its flashy red light show, as every employee in the building BUT our waitress walks by it, looks at it, and keeps walking. After at least 15 minutes of this, my mom finally had to yell at someone to get their attention just to get fry refills, which takes a second to do. And sure enough, as soon as we light the fire under the employees, suddenly the waitress shows up. Everyone is suddenly checking up on us every minute, offering drink refills, more fry refills--way too late to fix this guys. Some impression Red Robin made on her, they didn't even send a manager our way when clearly we were unhappy and disappointed with the staff.  What was supposed to be a nice lunch with the family (and this was my first time my mom had eaten here to top it off) turned out to be a disaster.  This isn't the first time Red Robin has let me down, but man they have a lot of improving to do before we consider going back---at least to this location.

Food is ok but service is awful! Every time I come here I can never get a refill on water and no one checks on us to see if our food is acceptable. We always wait forever to order, food takes forever to get to us, and after we receive our meal we don't see another employee until they give us our check. Won't ever come back here.

Very disappointing. Our server was friendly, however our food took ridiculously long to come, and when it came it was NOT hot, we all ordered burgers and fries, and they were NOT generous with the portions, there was maybe 5 fries on my plate. When we were finished eating the manager comes by and asks how everything was, and we told him " it was disappointing, extremely slow, cold food, we don't plan on coming back soon, hadn't been to a red robin in a long time." And he said " sorry that's not up to our standard, here's your bill" what the heck?! NOT IMPRESSED

I have been to this particular Red Robin about 30 times over the last three years. Lately the service has gotten very bad. Most of the time I have to ask for anything that I need, the waiter or waitress never seems to check back to see if I need anything, even though they walk by numerous times. Many times I will have an empty glass sitting on the table for 10-15 minutes, need more fries or ranch dressing, or just need some sweetener or napkins, only to be ignored by the wait staff.  I received an email from Red Robin saying that I had been chosen for a free dessert for 14 consecutive days. Because of this, I have been eating there every few days to take advantage of their offer. Yesterday when I ordered cheesecake, it took 23 minutes for it to arrive at the table. Really, how long does it take to cut a piece of cheesecake and put it on a plate?

Service was slow the two times I have been to this Red Robin.  The first time, hardly anyone else was there at lunchtime. It took a while for our food to arrive. The server was not friendly and brought a silverware napkin roll to my adult daughter, but not to me. So, my food was served, and I could have eaten it with my fingers since it was a burger and fries, but no napkin? The second time, it was a semi busy Sunday lunchtime, and it took a very long time before our food was served. The burger was good, the server was very nice, but the fries were subpar. It seemed the kitchen staff was having issues expediting the food.

Been a loyal customer for years, got a Cobb salad for takeout and it was the worst salad I have seen in awhile. After calling the restaurant and taking to the manager she informed me that there was a national egg shortage??? and that's why I had cucumber on my salad. Also she let me know that they are now serving a better quality of food so the portions are smaller. I refuse to pay $11.00 for a salad that looks like a starter salad. I will not be back to a Red Robin anytime soon.

Nope! All done here. I've been at this RR before and had real bad service but this time was it. I went for lunch alone and was greeted nicely at the door the young lady asked if I would like to sit in the bar I told her I would rather sit in the dinning area. She tried sitting me next to the bussing station I told her that would not work "Too noisy" She said that was understandable. I was seated at a two top table. My server came over and handed me a menu and said I'll  be right back. Well she never came back. Soon another young lady came by and asked I needed any thing while I was waiting for my order                                                                       I informed her that I had not ordered yet. I went on to tell her that I would be dinning alone that I know that most all restaurants don't like single seating customers and that I tip well. Just don't forget about me or my order. Well guess what? She forgot about me. After making my order I sat for what was over thirty minutes with no one refilling my water or asking me anything. The people sitting across from me even noticed that I was forgotten. I stopped a young girl and asked her to send the manager over. She asked if there was something that she could do. I said yes you could get the manager. I watched her walk over and start talking to a young man and then go back by the kitchen. About two minutes later a women and the young man came to my table. The young man asked what it was that I need to see the manager for? I asked Are you the manager? he replied no. The young lady asked me if there was a problem. I asked her are you the manager she said that the manager wasn't available and that I could talk to her. I told her that I have ordered and had not seen my server sense.                               She informed me that my server has left and my order was never put in. She said she was sorry and very embarrassed that something like that would happen. She then asked me what I had ordered. She then said that she would have the cooks make my order ASAP and I would not be charged. That would be fine I told her. About ten minutes later another young girl brings out my order. Well not only was it wrong it was cold. I then got up and started to walk towards the door the young girl at the door said thank you and said come back soon. I smiled and said thank you. Some one must have noticed that the food was untouched and I was leaving. The manager then came out as I was walking out the door and asked if there was anything I could help me with. I just smiled and said good day. One too many chances, No more. we're done.

Foods always decent. Service has gotten worse and worse the last 3 times there. I'd rather eat somewhere else. But its not always my choice.... Service has gotten much slower and less attentive. They have new tablets on the table that you can order food/drinks with and play games (for an additional $1.99 added to your bill) I think this has not helped them.

Probably the worst Red Robin I've been to, and have been going to them for 25 years since living in California.  My wife and I stopped here on a Friday night after a meeting as an impromptu "date night" activity.  It was around 9pm, and most of the younger families were gone and so not frantically busy.   I ordered a burger and my wife a salad.   A half hour went by, then 45 minutes.  I had to flag down several servers to find out where our food was... in the meantime people who'd arrived after we did were finishing eating.  When the food came, my burger had obviously spent the last 45 minutes under a heat lamp.  Took another 10 or so to get a waitress, who then had to check with another.  You get the picture.  They comped me the burger at least which is why this is not a one-star rating, but my wife's salad was very stale tasting as well. The place seems badly managed and in dire need of some quality control, and maybe they will get some, but in the meantime you can do a lot better locally than Red Robin.  I generally keep my reviews positive unless there is a real problem-- this place has one.

Horrible service, horrible bartender making drinks. Other tables getting water before us after taking our drink order. Did I say slow? Wow... Slow as frozen molasses...And still no water, drinks or napkins.  I am done with you Red Robin.

I really like the Smokey Point Red Robin for their consistent food quality and fast, friendly service. However, a recent remodel leaves me reminiscing and missing the old Red Robin.  I miss the carousel horses, Robin statue, and neon "Gourmet Burger Maker" sign that represented a bit of history from 1943.  The remodel leaves this Red Robin very plain jane.  Bathrooms at this particular establishment need some attention. They aren't very tidy and well kept!   The stalls in the women's bathroom are VERY tiny - and I am a petite lady.  You can barely open the door without hitting the toilet and trying to close the door behind you when there is 4 inches between the toilet and the door's swing range is near impossible.   Bussing staff need to check facilities more frequently to empty trash cans and restock necessities like toilet paper, soap, and paper towels.

Came here for a birthday dinner. Food took a long time to come out. The fries were really cold by the time we had got them. She gave us hot fries though but we had to wait again for food. My salad was soggy. Took a long time to get drink refills. My friend is a member of the rewards club and we came here so she could get a free birthday burger. She didn't even get that. The waitress said she took 10$ off the receipt but then came back and only  $3 was removed. My friend asked why she didn't get her burger off the receipt and she said she'll find out. She was gone for about 15 minutes and we were tired out waiting so my friend just paid the full price for her "free" burger. She said her manager was going to talk to us but we were ready to leave and didn't stick around. The Red Robin in Everett is way better. Just drive down there.

The quality has decreased over time.  I no longer live here so on my annual family visits I come to red robin because there aren't any on the east coast!  My cheeseburger was dry and the "bottomless" fries just didn't taste fresh.

Worse experience! Worse food. Our meal was under a heat lamp for 15 minutes before it got to us. We watched it sitting there the whole time. And not only was it under there but it had side salads so when the side salads came they were hot. Just gross. If I could give no stars I would. The service was awful too. We waited ten mins to get seated and then another 15 till our waitress came.

Had a great time at red robin last night. Food came quick and was very good.   Our waiter was very nice also.  They have crayons and coloring pages for the kids.  The menu is separate and laminated. Maybe they are trying hard to improve there service now. Nice job !

Let start off by saying that I love Red Robin burgers and the staff at this place were friendly but overall it was the worse experience I've ever had. The problems were that the food was horrible, my burger seemed like it had been sitting out for like 10 minutes and my sons food was cold and stiff. My second complaint was with the fact that our server had to go on break, which I understand, but they made us pay our bill with out asking if we wanted anything because she couldn't clock out with an open bill and once she left we were there for about 15 to 20 minutes longer and no one came to ask if we needed anything or to check on us. Once we got up no one seemed to notice and all the plates and cups were still on the table, so what I'm trying to say is that they never came to pick up anything once our server left. Like I said the staff was nice so I don't know who or what to blame but it was the worst experience I've ever had at a Red Robin.

We are at the restaurant as I write this. We come here all the time  and have sine the place first opened.  The food is what you would expect however the service had gone down the tubes. This is the 4th time in a row where we have had to wait more than 10 minutes (today it was about 15) just to have the server come to our table. They always say the same thing  - sorry for the wait. It seems like the servers disappear and really take their time about refilling your drinks. There was a time when we came to this RR and the service was quick and very good. Don't know if there was a management change or what but service here now really sucks. My son's drink is empty and 3 servers gave walked past looked at it and ignored it. I wrote this review after waiting more than 15 minutes for our drink service. We're now at 36 minutes in and still haven't received a salad and a prime rib dip sandwich. Our server is MIA and drinks sit empty

Now all Red Robins are hit and miss as many restaurants are these days, it must be getting really hard to find quality staff these days. But no Red Robin is more miss than hit than this one.  Many times over the years at this location I've waited for long periods of time to be just to be served let alone have anyone come around to take my drink order. After the meal is severed by someone other than the waiter, I've been lucky to even see my waiter/waitress again before the bill arrives. If I get lucky enough that the server does come around again after the food is served, they take forever to fetch whatever it was that I politely requested. I've had countless meal orders messed up, and meals served warm and nowhere near hot or fresh.  My worst experience occurred last weekend when I order the seafood scatter. To start I ordered it without coleslaw it arrived with coleslaw with extra dressing covering it, and all my food was sitting in it. I should also mention it was cooler than room temperature. I stated to the waitress who did come around this time that I had order this without coleslaw and everything is covered in dressing from it, she said she would have it replaced.  A few minutes later the same meal was returned, the coleslaw had been rubbed out of the basket a few of the shrimp and clam strips had be rubbed clean of the dressing but one of the fish pieces was still covered in and soggy from it. The waitress came back around I held it up to her and said it's the same meal someone just tried cleaning it up, and while I was holding it up to her I saw a hair on it in the light. The manager came over and replaced my meal with one that was hot fresh, and cooked to perfection, much better than I've had in a long time, but it didn't really make up for the frustration. This is one location I will not be returning to, and I've already reduced my visits to RR a great deal due to the poor food and service at many of their locations.

We were hungry for dinner after our haircuts (see my Salon Chirella review and make an appointment with Sandra!) so stopped here for a quick bite to eat. Service: so slow.  We first asked to sit in the bar but when we noticed there weren't any booths we asked for a booth in the main dining room.  The hostess (nice enough) offered to bus the super large corner booth (big enough for about 6 people).  We told her we didn't really need that much space but she insisted... and then it took longer to get it cleaned then just sit in the main dining area.  Once we were seated, the server (again, nice enough) was not really attentive.  Rather than asking if we wanted more to drink (we did not), she deposited more drinks at our table.   Food:  okay.  It's easy to get distracted by the big ole burgers and bottomless fries but I was proud of myself for ordering a salad... albeit the Whiskey Chicken BBQ salad with all dressing and sauces on the side (I am projecting, but I bet it's a safe bet that they use way too much dressing).  The avocado on the side was perfectly fresh and delicious... the rest of the salad looked a little limp.  And of course, it's a HUGE portion size so barely ate half of it (and didn't bother taking the rest home). Red Robin is what it is.  Just wish there were some more options in that area, but I'm sure anything else that shows up will be chains chains and more chains.

Brought the grand kids ( 4 & 6) here for a quick lunch during the drive back to home. First visit to this I-5 location in Smokey Point. Seated promptly before noon and was given menus. Notice after being seated that nobody was receiving food yet so the kitchen was not keeping up with the lunch crowd. We received our food about 25 minutes after ordering. All was correct and tasted fine except for the cold fries! Red Robin has been on a small initial portion but bottomless fries kick and apparently precooks large batches. Definitely affects the quality served. I ordered my Burnin love burger slightly pink in order to enjoy a juicy patty. It was not overcooked like some past experience but still very dry. Perhaps frozen meat or pressed too often on the grill? When I grill a patty it is juicy. At $10.95 for a burger I expected better quality food. Spent $44.00 for lunch including soft drinks. Somethings not right here!

It feels like a cafeteria! If I'm going to leave behind my first born child and right arm to cover my bill for a mediocre burger, I'd rather not feel like I spent the meal bumping elbows with a stranger and their screaming child. The wait staff is mediocre, the food is mediocre and I certainly don't go out of my way to eat here. My 10 year old loves it so we end up visiting from time to time much to my chagrin.

After a day of hiking in the woods, we landed at Red Robin on the way home. We sat in the bar as we normally do (first time at this RR). The tables had not been cleaned off and all still weren't by the time we left. It wasn't that busy but the waitress was bad, the bartender barbie had a perpetual scowl and there was inner squabbling between the staff. The margarita sucked - tasted very watery. But you can always count on good fries, right? Well, not this time. To be avoided in my opinion until they clean up their staff.

Worst service I have ever got at a Red Robin.  Service makes whole dining experience bad.  Asked four times for more fried and the only thing they brought me was the bill.  Me son went home in tears.  We will never return and suggest everyone else avoid this place.  Go somewhere better.  This place does not live up to its name.

My wife and I have been going to red Robin restaurants for decades, maybe twice a year or a little more. It was nice to know what to expect. The location at twin lakes in Marysville, has been the most frequently visited by us recently.  The last 3-4 times have been very disappointing. Cold stale fries, servers who never check back, greasy vegipatty, (tough to accomplish), and the reliability of expectations met ended. We are not the type to overreact or complain in the restaurant so we just pay our bill, tip 20%, and give them another chance or 3. We're done now. Fair beer selection and sports on many screens earned both stars. Sorry RR.

Our experiences here have been kind of hit or miss, being a couple in a family restaurant, we usually get stuck in the 2 person booth that is along the main walkway, near to where the draft from the door will come through, making it not the greatest private place to eat.   The food has been good, if you know what to order.  I have my usuals, the Whiskey River BBQ Wrap, which I love, The Apple Walnut Chicken Salad is GREAT, and if I'm in the mood for a burger, I'll get the Whiskey River BBQ burger.  I find their burgers a bit salty though and I think the only one that doesn't taste that way to me is the Bacon Cheeseburger.  My fiancee has had much worse luck, do not, repeat DO NOT order the fish and chips here.  He has twice over a year and a half span of time and both times they were so greasy, we think they didn't even drain the fish after it came out of the fryer.  The problem was handled properly by the waitstaff and management but we did not opt to have the same meal replaced as he had lost his appetite due to the sheer amount of grease.   Overall, try it, its a fun place for a birthday or just a good bite depending on what you like, just stay away from the fish and chips!

After reading some of the negative reviews I really have to wonder if they reviewed the right place. I have gone to this red robin for years and they are always awesome. I've been to the one in Everett, Kent, South Center, and this place is always they best. The food is always perfect and the service is always amazing. They even call me their regular when I walk in. This red robin is definitely the best.

Even though I'm a vegetarian I LOVE Red Robin! They have the best fries, fun drinks and lots and LOTS of food options. I get a cheeseburger (hold the meat) and it's like one big grilled cheese with vegetables on it. The service is always fast and the Marysville Red Robin is a nice one!

I've eaten at Red Robins on the entire I-5 corridor from Bellingham, WA to Southern, CA (also include Idaho, TX, and Utah). The Marysville Red Robin has the best service and have never had an issue with the food.  Prompt service with refills on both drinks and fries.

This place is always packed and hectic.  The dinner rush is the worst.  Expect to be standing around in a big herd of people by the door.   The food is fine, but you'll be waiting a while for it.  The wait staff is generally friendly unless they get stuck having to constantly come by to refill your drinks.  God help you if you got stuck with a soda that had no syrup in it.     The last time we went, our friends had a coupon for a free dessert for their kid's birthday.  Her dessert was forgotten.  It will probably be the last time we go.  It was pretty messed up since tons of people around us were getting their birthday desserts before, during, and after our dinner.  We sat around for a good 20 minutes after the check came, but no dessert showed up.
Wonderful burgers, amazing family friendly service, definately the best red robins to go to in snohomish county.

Always greeted with a smile wonderful greeters and servers. With that said, I'm not sure what has happened over the course of three years. This particular red robin is horrible. Food took over 40 minutes, before I decided to leave. I was tired of wating. The girl behind the counter was fondling the fries and the tickets with the same glove on her hand. The onion towers hit the heat lamps. Tell me that it's washed and sanitized ever night. You need alot of assistance management. Poor quality control. Never returning.

I want to say first that I love the red robin brand.  Great menu! This location however always disappoints us.  We've been there only 3 times in the last few years.  And each time there is a major problem with the food.  Either the burgers are too rare (raw on one occasion) and this last time there was hair in the lettuce.  The servers are working hard.  That is never a problem.  But gosh- if you serve bad food and then make us wait for more, at least compensate us. We will not be returning.

Usually a great place. But we were asked to sit in the bar because there was a new hostess training, we didn't mind, except it took almost 2 hours to get a quick dinner. I got a wrap and soup combo, both were amazing but why it took so long didn't make sense. Especially when every family we got seated before was leaving before we got dinner. Definitely need more staff

Great service and great food. Came in after 9pm with the little ones.  Server was very friendly (especially to my 5 year old who had a whole list of demands). Food came out quick and everything tasted great.

Who does not a well dressed bird?  I passed on the cock and went for the fish and chips on this visit....wish they did a half portion, maybe they do...or will.  I shall ask next time.  :)  Damn you fries..stay away! Boy loves happy hour beers and that makes me like them too.

Have been coming to this Red Robin a couple of times a month since I moved to the area five years ago and always had fine service and good food, however, I stopped in tonight and there were quite a few people waiting for a table, but decided to wait anyway. I gave the hostess my name and told her I was a party of one, then sat down to wait to be called. After waiting nearly a half hour and three or four parties that came after me being seated, I went up to the new person at the podium ( a skinny guy with greasy black hair) and asked what the deal was. He asked if I was the party of one and I told him I was, he then blatantly lies and says "I called you, but you didn't respond." That was complete B.S. as I was sitting right in front him and I KNOW he never called my name. He then says " I can put you back on the list and it will be another 15-20 minutes," or I could sit at the end of the bar. I just said no and walked out. Went to Blazing Onion instead, was seated right away and had an enjoyable meal.

Meh. It's so hit and miss at this place, however I think I've experienced my last here. I ordered the bacon avocado burger on a lettuce bun with a side casear salad. I requested no onions and to change the cheese from swiss to pepper jack. On my side salad I asked for no croutons. After receiving my order I received a burger with onions and swiss cheese, and my salad had croutons. The burger was probably one of the worst that I have had in a while. Juices were flying out of this burger like crazy. Not to mention it took 10 minutes waiting for the waiter to ask us what we wanted to order. Not a great experience in my books!
This red robin is pretty good! Its always packed solid. The wait staff is always super awesome and nice! Whiskey bbq chicken sandwich is awesome!:)

Wasn't so happy with the check in gal however way to go to the manager and my waitress who gave me exceptional service and went way beyond the call of duty ! My Son and I had amazing food, great service and the manager is just that a manager ! Hes in that position for a reason ! He fixes issues and makes sure they have a grwat experience !! Way to go the extra mile and take care of the customer ! I was there Saturday December 14th 2013 at 4:30 pm! Wish i knew the manager and the waiters name but hopefully corporate takes the extra step to check the schedule and give props!! Thanks again for the great service and food!

Every time I come here I like to get the soup and salad combo with clam chowder because the chowder is normally great. When my best friend and I went there for dinner our pretzel bites were over cooked, our spinach artichoke dip had no artichokes, and my chowder was disgusting. The bowl was coated in coagulation chowder and the soup itself was super runny and not like the chowder I've always gotten. It was like the poured the bowl of soup it sat too long so they poured it out and put more and even that was luke warm. Was it the bottom of the batch of something?  It was like the cooks didn't even care. I couldn't make myself eat more than a spoonful it was just so disappointing and the waitress asked if I wanted a different soup, but none of the other soups sounded remotely appealing and I just told her I was full enough from the 2 appetizers my friend and I shared and my salad so she took the price of the soup off. When we left I looked at the kitchen to see 4 cooks that looked like dive bar line cooks and it made sense that they probably did not care what so ever about the quality of the food going out. I've been a server and I can't even understand how she could look at the bowl and think that it is acceptable to have even served me the nasty bowl of soup, I would not have served that. I get that it's a chain restaurant but really?!  It wasn't even busy and it was earlier evening. Disappointing. Went here again last week despite my last experience because my boyfriend wanted to go. I himmed and hawwed if I wanted to try again for the clam chowder salad and decided I'd give it a shot. This time the chowder was in a different type of bowl, flatter and wider instead of the little tiny bowl I got last time with the little handle. The chowder was like the chowder I've gotten before unlike the one they served me the last time I was in so that was good. However, my soup was barely even Luke warm... as I'm eating my soup and salad I notice the millions of greasy fingerprints all over the rim of both bowls. I mean every square inch of the rims were covered in multiple layers of fingerprints. How many people touched my dishes and how many didn't wash their freaking hands?! I was so hungry I finished my soup and salad all the while praying I didn't get food poisoning from someone not washing their greasy hands and then touching my bowls of food. Terrifying. Minor discrepancies; I didn't get a fork for my salad and had to ask, I actually got the garlic bread with my chowder this time but it was only 1 rock hard piece that was inedible.
Great burgers but its a chain restraunt and for the price you can find better

I've had so many different experiences here with both staff and with quality of food here. I have left here satisfied and not so satisfied at different times. It honestly seems like a crap shoot with what your going to get here. Also, it seems like they always have a long wait.

We went here to grab a few drinks and a burger during a Friday evening. The place was packed but the host seated us pretty quick. Ordered some of their wings, which was amazing by the way! Despite the amazing service from my waitress my only complaint was not from my server but from the bar. Pretty much every glass that came out of that bar was imprinted with finger prints and lipstick... it only takes a sec to wipe off the brim after the dishwasher. Will be back but hopefully something changes.

It's a Red Robin.  I like it here when I want a dependable, not-so-expensive burger. The one difference about this Red Robin, in contrast to in the ones Seattle, is that everyone is white.  As a half-white person, that half of me was totally fine with the white-to-brown ratio.  But as a brown person, I kept one eye on my teriyaki burger and the other eye was scanning for the confederate flag.
Sometimes good , sometimes not so good. I grow weary of the wait time to get a seat and the noise level. Just not worth it anymore.

I have been going to Red Robin for 15-20 years now and have only had one other not so great experience. For the most part, it's ok. Some days/food items are better than others, but no one is perfect. Today's experience at the Marysville location was by far the worst. I went in to grab a burger and shake, while the contractor worked on tile at my retail space in the area. Big mistake. Would have been better off at McDonald's (which should say a lot). From the minute I walked in, the service was sketchy. The gals at the hostess stand were cleaning off menus and turned to say hello to me, but didn't actually stop working, as if they really wanted to help me. I said I'd called in a carry out order, so they pointed me to the bar. I went to the bar and stood in the bar, next to the only terminal in the bar for nearly 10 minutes, before one of the servers from in back passed and asked if I'd been helped. I told her I'd called in a to go order and she turns, looks over my shoulder, to the bartender, that I hadn't noticed before, sitting in the booth with guests behind me, just chatting it up. She walks me to the other end of the bar and tells me someone will be with me momentarily.  The bartender then gets up, comes over to me, and as she passes me, I hear someone tell her 'carry out order on line 1' (she didn't pick up the line until I was walking out of the restaurant nearly 6-7 min later). She doesn't respond to them, but asks me if I'm picking up an order. I say yes, she asks the name, and takes my card for payment. I tell her before she swipes it, I'd like to add a strawberry shake to the order. She says ok, adds the shake, swipes my card, then leaves it face side up on the counter, as she goes down to make the shake. She scoops out 2 scoops of strawberry mix, then starts to pour milk in the cup she's going to make the shake in. She must see something in the cup that shouldn't be, though because first she starts to stick her hand in and grab it, then she decides against this, pouring out the contents of the cup, wiping off the shake machine with her hand, and starting over (with the same cup). She then scoops two more scoops of strawberry, opens the milk and sniffs it, then pours a little less than the previous time into the cup, fills the cup with ice cream, and mixes away. When my food comes out, I leave, only to open the box in the car and find out they're old, cold fries.  I called in a to go order, was told that it would take 20 minutes. I arrived in less than 10 minutes, waited at the bar for nearly 15 minutes, and then left with cold food? Oh - it gets worse. I turn my car around, go back and park, take my bag inside, and tell the gal I'm sorry to be a pain, but can I please get fresh fries. SHe says oh sure. Sorry about that. We do serve those here. She comes back with a small, white styrofoam box of fries, and off I go. I get in the car, open up the new fries, and realize - yup - you guessed it - same batch of fries. Old, cold fries...  I'm not going in a third time. I figure I'll eat the burger, drink the shake, and call it good. The contractor calls to say he's done, so I rush out of the lot to go inspect his work before locking up for the day. As I'm leaving the lot, I take a nice, long sip  of my shake, only to feel something hard in my mouth. I swallow most of the liquid, then getting on the freeway, pull out what appears to be a brownish/black glob of something very hard but that smears onto the envelope I find on the passenger seat to put it on. Yuck!!! NO idea what that was, but it obviously ruined the shake.  So, now we're down from fries and a shake and burger to just the burger. I get back to my space, toss the fries, toss the shake, keep the burger. Inspect my contractor's work, then sit down to eat my burger and finish up email before going home. I unwrap it - and the patty is burned so badly on this thing, I cannot eat it as it is, so I pull the edges off all the way around (that are burned to a crisp - I mean black burned not just a little on the done side), try eating the middle, but the strips from the grill on this thing are as black as the outside. I ended up pulling the pineapple off and just eating the pineapple and tomatoes from my bonzai burger. I thought of calling in to speak with the manager, but figured you know what - in today's day and age - there's just no excuse for that. One mistake I can let slide... Two possibly. Terrible service, cold food, AND burned food in one transaction? That just screams we don't care all day long.  Take your money elsewhere. Had there been the option of negative stars here, I would have used it.

Extremely good burgers! I always get the Hawaiian one. Join their free Royalty club and you get free food on your bday & after you buy so many. It adds up fast & I've gotten many freebies with this card. The wait staff is friendly and you can not beat the steak fries! Ask for the Ranch dippin sauce for a real taste sensation. Its so easy to fill up on the fries that you end up taking your meal home in a to go box for the next day. I call these meals 2 fer 1 cause I always stretch it into 2 meals at least! If theres a wait list, ask to sit in the bar where they have 2 & 4 seaters available too.

I've been here a few times, and with my last visit just a few days ago... I won't be going back.... The service went down, and the food left much to be desired.. The Avaocado was so runny it was more like a slurry with food coloring... my chicken was luke warm, and seemed to be made my Chef Mike (the microwave).. I also happened to see one guy in the kitchen who kept wiping his nose on his HANDS and NOT washing... I hope he was only loading dirty dishes into the dishwasher.......

Okay let me preface this review by saying I, myself am a Red Robin employee at a different location. Driving through Smokey Point when my boyfriend and I decide that a  monster cookie magic milkshake sounds pretty good and decide to call one in to go. My boyfriend goes in and comes out with the milkshake and we leave. Upon leaving I realize that, A. this milkshake is not a monster. Idk if these red robin employees know that there are two different to-go cups for this reason. So we paid for a large size and got a regular, but whatever no huge deal right? Then B. This bartender put, I kid you not, one oreo in the whole thing and no chocolate syrup. Like do you even know how to make a cookie magic shake because this is vanilla? I normally don't write these reviews because I know how it feels to be in the service industry but i'm just in shock at how rediculous this is. Should have listened to the other reviews I guess because this is the only Red Robin i know that has a 2.5 star rating lol.

We were out to lunch with our parents on a Sunday, and we all had a nice time.  Our server was nice but not aggressively perky or in-your-face (which has always been my biggest complaint with Red Robin, so I really liked that).  I wanted especially to note that my sister was unhappy with her salad (it was just incredibly soupy with dressing), and the manager came over to obtain particulars and then removed it from our bill.  They offered to replace it as well, but she declined because she had eaten half of my meal instead and was satisfied.  We were very impressed and will definitely go back to this restaurant.
